edu.uga.cs1302.txtbuff

Class TextLine

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uga.cs1302.txtbuff.TextLine

  • public class TextLine
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains constructors and methods for a class intended to handle a line of text, store it as an character array, and represent this data in certain ways.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  TextLine.Editable
      This interface is later to be implemented in the editableTextLine class.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int capacity
      The capacity variable represents the size of the array that each TextLine object creates.
      static int DEFAULT_SIZE
      This is a constant that represents the generic size of each of the arrays.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TextLine()
      This constructs an empty TextLine object with the default size constant as the capacity of the object's internal charArray.
      TextLine(java.lang.String line)
      This constructs a TextLine object that contains the string given in the parameter individually within the object's internal charArray.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int capacity()
      This simply returns the value of the capacity variable of the TextLine object.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object anObject)
      This method simply returns true if all of the characters in the character array of one object equals the characters in the character array of another.
      int indexOf(java.lang.String fragment)
      This method locates the first occurance of the fragment given in the parameters of the method within the TextLine object itself.
      int indexOf(java.lang.String fragment, int fromIndex)
      This method does the same as the other overloaded method with the same name in this class, but instead of looking for the fragment starting from charArray[0], the method begins its search from charArray[index] from within the object.
      int length()
      This method returns the length of the TextLine object by counting things that are not null character instances.
      java.lang.String toString()
      This method returns a string representing the values stored within the TextLine object's charArray.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_SIZE

        public static final int DEFAULT_SIZE
        This is a constant that represents the generic size of each of the arrays. If arrays need to be expanded, it is done so by this interval. It is a constant so it can constantly be referenced.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • capacity

        public int capacity
        The capacity variable represents the size of the array that each TextLine object creates.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextLine

        public TextLine()
        This constructs an empty TextLine object with the default size constant as the capacity of the object's internal charArray.

      • TextLine

        public TextLine(java.lang.String line)
        This constructs a TextLine object that contains the string given in the parameter individually within the object's internal charArray.
        Parameters:
        line - The line parameter is the string that is to be placed at the beginning of the TextLine's charArray.

    • Method Detail

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(java.lang.String fragment)
        This method locates the first occurance of the fragment given in the parameters of the method within the TextLine object itself. If no match is foud, then a -1 is returned.
        Parameters:
        fragment - This is the string that is searched for within the TextLine for this method.
        Returns:
        This returns the first instance of the fragment within the TextLine. If the fragment is not found within the TextLine, then a -1 value is returned.

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(java.lang.String fragment,
          int fromIndex)
        This method does the same as the other overloaded method with the same name in this class, but instead of looking for the fragment starting from charArray[0], the method begins its search from charArray[index] from within the object.
        Parameters:
        fragment - This is the string that is searched for within the TextLine object.
        fromIndex - This is the index from which the search for the fragment begins.
        Returns:
        This method returns an integer value of the first occurance of the fragment from the starting index. If no match is found, then a -1 is returned.

      • length

        public int length()
        This method returns the length of the TextLine object by counting things that are not null character instances.
        Returns:
        This returns the length of the TextLine object.

      • capacity

        public int capacity()
        This simply returns the value of the capacity variable of the TextLine object.
        Returns:
        This returns the value of the capacity variable of the TextLine object.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object anObject)
        This method simply returns true if all of the characters in the character array of one object equals the characters in the character array of another. The method returns false otherwise.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method returns a string representing the values stored within the TextLine object's charArray.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
